p: The data obtained from the present study also showed that AESG did not cause significant alterations ( P < 0.05) in plasma sodium, chloride, and potassium ion concentrations, respectively ( Fig. 8); that the electrolyte regulatory function of the kidneys was not compromised ( Figs. 14â€“17). However, there was a marked reduction in plasma sodium ion concentration of test rats given AESG 2000 mg/kg. Plants capable of lowering sodium ion in the system are perceived as possible diuretic agents [ 72].
